channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Bank of England, has issued a public statement and roadmap advising the global financial sector to begin a coordinated transition to quantum-resilient technology. The guidance warns that advanced quantum compu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Supply Chain Attack: Malicious npm Packages Steal Credentials from n8n Automation Platform
item.description:
A novel supply chain attack discovered by Endor Labs is targeting users of the n8n workflow automation platform. Attackers are publishing malicious packages to the npm registry, disguised as legitimate 'community nodes' for popular services. When an unsuspecting user installs one of these nodes and ...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds
item.description:
The World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026' report, produced with Accenture, reveals a major shift in the threat landscape: cyber-enabled fraud and phishing have now surpassed ransomware as the top concern for global business leaders. The report highlights that fraud has rea...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: GoBruteforcer Botnet Exploits Weak Credentials on Linux Servers to Target Crypto Wallets
item.description:
A modular Go-based botnet named GoBruteforcer is actively compromising internet-facing Linux servers by brute-forcing weak credentials for services like FTP, MySQL, and PostgreSQL. According to Check Point Research, the campaign's success is fueled by the widespread use of default or weak passwords,...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: High-Severity Code Injection Flaw in Open WebUI (CVE-2025-64496) Allows RCE
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-64496, has been discovered in Open WebUI, a popular self-hosted interface for large language models (LLMs). The flaw, found by Cato Networks, allows a malicious AI server to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into a user's browser session. This can be...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Unveils 'RustyWater' RAT in Middle East Espionage
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored advanced persistent threat (APT) group MuddyWater, also known as Mango Sandstorm and TA450, has been observed deploying a new, custom-built Remote Access Trojan (RAT) named 'RustyWater'. According to research from CloudSEK, this new implant, written in the Rust programmin...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Hits French Infra Giant Bouygues, Claims 80GB Data Theft
item.description:
The prolific Qilin ransomware group has listed French multinational infrastructure firm Bouygues Energies & Services as its latest victim on its dark web leak site. The group claims to have exfiltrated 80 GB of highly sensitive data, comprising 31,000 files. Most alarmingly, the threat actors allege...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Apex Legends 'Remote Control' Hack Patched After Streamers Hijacked
item.description:
Respawn Entertainment, the developer of the popular battle royale game Apex Legends, rapidly deployed a patch on January 10, 2026, to fix a significant security exploit. The vulnerability allowed a malicious actor to remotely take control of other players' characters during a live match, an incident...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Claims 900 GB Data Theft from Nissan
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against Japanese automotive giant Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. In a post on its dark web leak site on January 10, 2026, the group alleged it had stolen approximately 900 GB of sensitive corporate data. To back up its claim, Everest published s...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: High-Severity Flaw in Mailpit Dev Tool Allows Email Interception
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-22689, has been discovered in Mailpit, a popular email testing tool for developers. The flaw is a Cross-Site WebSocket Hijacking (CSWSH) issue affecting all versions prior to 1.28.2. It allows a remote attacker to intercept sensitive data, including...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: French Bank Customers Hit by 'Quishing' Scam Using Fake Physical Cards
item.description:
A highly deceptive phishing campaign, dubbed 'quishing,' is targeting bank customers in France using a blend of physical and digital tactics. Scammers are sending official-looking letters by postal mail that contain a high-quality counterfeit bank card. The letter instructs the recipient to 'activat...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Texas Health System Breach Exposes Data of Over 34,000 Patients
item.description:
Vida Y Salud Health Systems Inc., a nonprofit health center serving rural communities in South Texas, has reported a data breach that exposed the sensitive personal and medical information of 34,504 patients. The organization detected unauthorized access to its network in October 2025, where an atta...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Financial Sector Warned of Systemic Supply Chain Risk and 'Indirect Ransomware'
item.description:
A new threat intelligence report for 2025-2026 reveals a perilous cyber landscape for the financial sector, dominated by systemic supply chain risks and evolving ransomware tactics. Citing data that 97% of U.S. banks were breached via third-party suppliers in 2024, the report underscores the critica...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack, Policy and Compliance

item.title: YARA-X Update Helps Analysts Avoid Flawed Detection Rules
item.description:
Version 1.11.0 of YARA-X, a popular tool for malware analysis, has been released with a key enhancement aimed at improving the accuracy of detection rules. The update introduces 'hash function warnings,' a feature that alerts security analysts when they make common errors in hash string comparisons,...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach
item.description:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a major data breach affecting approximately 705,000 state residents. The breach was caused by incorrect privacy settings on internal planning maps that were inadvertently made public on a mapping website for up to four years. The exposed...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese State Hackers 'Salt Typhoon' Breach U.S. Congressional Committee Emails
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group known as Salt Typhoon has reportedly compromised the email systems of staff members for several key U.S. House of Representatives committees. The cyberespionage campaign, detected in December 2025, targeted aides on influential panels including those oversee...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Cisco Patches Medium-Severity Flaws in Snort 3 Engine That Could Lead to DoS and Data Leaks
item.description:
Cisco has disclosed two medium-severity vulnerabilities, CVE-2026-20026 and CVE-2026-20027, in its widely used Snort 3 detection engine. The flaws exist in the processing of DCE/RPC traffic and can be triggered by a remote, unauthenticated attacker. CVE-2026-20026 (CVSS 5.8) is a use-after-free issu...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Patches High-Severity Chrome Flaw That Could Allow Attackers to Bypass Security Policies
item.description:
Google has issued a security update for its Chrome browser, patching a high-severity vulnerability tracked as CVE-2026-0628. The flaw, which affects Chrome on Windows, macOS, and Linux, is described as an "insufficient policy enforcement" issue within the WebView component. An attacker could exploit...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Online Betting Giant BetVictor Discloses Major Data Breach, Customer Data Compromised
item.description:
BetVictor, a major European online gambling company, has officially disclosed a significant data breach that compromised sensitive customer information. The security incident was first detected on January 8, 2026, during routine security audits and has caused unspecified operational disruptions. The...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Data of 17.5 Million Instagram Users Leaked on Hacker Forum After Scraping Attack
item.description:
The personal data of approximately 17.5 million Instagram users has been leaked on the BreachForums hacking forum. The data, posted by a user named 'Solonik,' was allegedly obtained via automated data scraping from public APIs. The leaked information includes full names, email addresses, phone numbe...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing

item.title: Critical OpenSSH Flaw Exposes Moxa Industrial Switches to Remote Code Execution
item.description:
Industrial networking vendor Moxa has issued a security advisory for a critical vulnerability, CVE-2023-38408, affecting its EDS-G4000 and RKS-G4000 series industrial Ethernet switches. The flaw resides in the OpenSSH service integrated into the device firmware and could allow a remote attacker to e...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management

item.title: FBI: North Korea's Kimsuky APT Using 'Quishing' to Bypass MFA
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has issued a formal advisory warning that the North Korean state-sponsored threat group Kimsuky (also known as APT43) is actively using malicious QR codes in spear-phishing emails. This tactic, dubbed 'quishing,' is designed to bypass traditional email ...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

item.title: London Councils Hit by Major Cyberattack, Resident Data Exposed
item.description:
A significant cyberattack targeting a shared IT system used by multiple London councils has resulted in a data breach exposing the sensitive personal information of thousands of residents. The incident, which affected Kensington and Chelsea Council among others, has caused widespread service disrupt...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

item.title: Critical 9.8 CVSS RCE Flaw Hits Trend Micro Apex Central
item.description:
Trend Micro has released patches for multiple vulnerabilities in its on-premise Apex Central security management console, including a critical remote code execution (RCE) flaw, CVE-2025-69258, with a CVSS score of 9.8. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to load a malicious D...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Italian Manufacturer Cressi
item.description:
The prolific Russia-linked Qilin ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on Cressi, a major Italian manufacturer of diving and water sports equipment. The claim was posted on the group's darknet leak site. As of January 9, 2026, the gang has not leaked any stolen data or set a p...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: CISA Issues Six New Advisories for Hitachi and Mitsubishi ICS Flaws
item.description:
On January 8, 2026, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released six new Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories. The alerts detail vulnerabilities discovered in products from Hitachi Energy and Mitsubishi Electric. These products, including the Hitachi Energy Asset ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: Cisco Patches Zero-Day Information Disclosure Flaw in ISE Platform
item.description:
Cisco has patched a high-severity zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2026-20029, in its Identity Services Engine (ISE) and ISE Passive Identity Connector (ISE-PIC). The flaw could allow an authenticated, remote administrator to read arbitrary files from the underlying system. The vulnerability is due to im...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

item.title: Cyberattacks on Automotive and Logistics Supply Chains Skyrocket
item.description:
A new report from Everstream Analytics reveals a dramatic escalation in cyberattacks targeting global supply chains. In 2025, the automotive manufacturing industry experienced a staggering 722% increase in cyber incidents compared to the previous year. The logistics industry was also heavily impacte...
